definitions.definition: an area of knowledge or activity; especially one that somebody is responsible for

examples.text: Physics used to be very much a male domain.
things that happen outside the domain of the home

definitions.definition: a set of websites on the internet that end with the same group of letters, for example ‘.com’, ‘.org’
lands owned or ruled by a particular person, government, etc., especially in the past

examples.text: The Spice Islands were within the Spanish domains.

definitions.definition: the range of possible values of a particular variable

wordOrigin: late Middle English (denoting heritable or landed property): from French domaine, alteration (by association with Latin dominus ‘lord’) of Old French demeine ‘belonging to a lord’, from Latin dominicus, from dominus ‘lord, master’.
